summary.long: Colossians is a book of the New Testament.

verses.text: Paul, an apostle of Jesus Christ, by the will of God, and Timothy our brother,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
To the saints and faithful brothers in Christ who are at Colosse:
Grace to you and peace from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: We give thanks to God and the Father of our Lord Jesus Christ, praying always for you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For we heard of your faith in Christ Jesus and your love for all the saints,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: because of the hope which is laid up for you in heaven, of which you have already heard in the word of the truth of the gospel,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: which has come to you, as it has in all the world, and brings forth fruit, as it has also in you, since the day you heard it and knew the grace of God in truth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you also learned of Epaphras, our dear fellow servant, who is a faithful minister of Christ for you,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: who also declared to us your love in the Spirit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For this reason we also, since the day we heard it, do not cease to pray for you and to ask that you may be filled with the knowledge of His will in all wisdom and spiritual understanding;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: that you may walk in a manner worthy of the Lord, pleasing to all, being fruitful in every good work, and increasing in the knowledge of God,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: strengthened with all might according to His glorious power, enduring everything with perseverance and patience joyfully,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: giving thanks to the Father, who has enabled us to be partakers in the inheritance of the saints in light.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He has delivered us from the power of darkness and has transferred us into the kingdom of His dear Son,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: in whom we have redemption through His blood, the forgiveness of sins.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He is the image of the invisible God and the firstborn of every creature.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For by Him all things were created that are in heaven and that are in earth, visible and invisible, whether they are thrones, or dominions, or principalities, or powers. All things were created by Him and for Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He is before all things, and in Him all things hold together.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He is the head of the body, the church. He is the beginning, the firstborn from the dead, so that in all things He may have the preeminence.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For it pleased the Father that in Him all fullness should dwell,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and to reconcile all things to Himself by Him, having made peace through the blood of His cross, by Him, I say—whether they are things in earth, or things in heaven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you, who were formerly alienated and enemies in your mind by wicked works, yet now He has reconciled
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: in the body of His flesh through death, to present you holy and blameless and above reproach in His sight,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: if you continue in the faith, grounded and settled, and are not removed from the hope of the gospel, which you have heard, and which was preached to every creature which is under heaven, and of which I, Paul, have become a servant.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now I rejoice in my sufferings for your sake and fill up in my flesh that which is lacking in the afflictions of Christ, for the sake of His body, which is the church.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I have been made a servant of it according to the commission of God, which has been given to me for you, to fulfill the word of God,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: even the mystery which has been hidden from past ages and generations, but now is revealed to His saints.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: To them God would make known what is the glorious riches of this mystery among the nations. It is Christ in you, the hope of glory,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: whom we preach, warning everyone and teaching everyone in all wisdom, so that we may present them perfect in Christ Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In this I labor, striving according to His power, which effectively works in me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I would like you to know what a great struggle I am having for you, and for those at Laodicea, and for everyone who has not seen my face in the flesh,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: that their hearts may be comforted, being knit together in love, and receive all the riches and assurance of full understanding, and knowledge of the mystery of God, both of the Father and of Christ,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: in whom are hidden all the treasures of wisdom and knowledge.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now this I say lest anyone beguile you with enticing words.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For though I am absent in the flesh, yet I am with you in spirit, rejoicing and seeing your orderliness and the steadfastness of your faith in Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As you have received Christ Jesus the Lord, so walk in Him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: rooted and built up in Him and established in the faith, as you have been taught, and abounding with thanksgiving.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Beware lest anyone captivate you through philosophy and vain deceit, in the tradition of men and the elementary principles of the world, and not after Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For in Him lives all the fullness of the Godhead bodily.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you are complete in Him, who is the head of all authority and power.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In Him you were also circumcised with the circumcision made without hands, by putting off the body of the sins of the flesh, by the circumcision of Christ,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: buried with Him in baptism, in which also you were raised with Him through the faith of the power of God, who has raised Him from the dead.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you, being dead in your sins and the uncircumcision of your flesh, He has resurrected together with Him, having forgiven you all sins.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He blotted out the handwriting of ordinances that was against us and contrary to us, and He took it out of the way, nailing it to the cross.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And having disarmed authorities and powers, He made a show of them openly, triumphing over them by the cross.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore let no one judge you regarding food, or drink, or in respect of a holy day or new moon or sabbath days.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are shadows of things to come, but the substance belongs to Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do not let anyone cheat you of your reward by delighting in false humility and the worship of angels, dwelling on those things which he has not seen, vainly arrogant due to his unspiritual mind,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and not supporting the head, from which the entire body, nourished and knit together by joints and sinews, grows as God gives the increase.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore, if you died with Christ to the elementary principles of the world, why, as if you were living in the world, do you subject yourself to legalistic rules?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Do not touch! Do not taste! Do not handle!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These all are to perish with use and are aligned with the commandments and doctrines of men.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These things have indeed a show of wisdom in self-imposed worship and humility and neglecting of the body, but are worthless against the indulgence of the flesh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If you then were raised with Christ, desire those things which are above, where Christ sits at the right hand of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Set your affection on things above, not on things on earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For you are dead, and your life is hidden with Christ in God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Christ who is our life shall appear, then you also shall appear with Him in glory.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore put to death the parts of your earthly nature: sexual immorality, uncleanness, inordinate affection, evil desire, and covetousness, which is idolatry.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Because of these things, the wrath of God comes on the sons of disobedience.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You also once walked in these, when you lived in them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But now you must also put away all these: anger, wrath, malice, blasphemy, and filthy language out of your mouth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do not lie one to another, since you have put off the old nature with its deeds,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and have embraced the new nature, which is renewed in knowledge after the image of Him who created it,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: where there is neither Greek nor Jew, circumcision nor uncircumcision, barbarian, Scythian, slave nor free, but Christ is all and in all.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So embrace, as the elect of God, holy and beloved, a spirit of mercy, kindness, humbleness of mind, meekness, and longsuffering.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Bear with one another and forgive one another. If anyone has a quarrel against anyone, even as Christ forgave you, so you must do.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And above all these things, embrace love, which is the bond of perfection.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let the peace of God, to which also you are called in one body, rule in your hearts. And be thankful.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let the word of Christ dwell in you richly in all wisdom, teaching and admonishing one another in psalms and hymns and spiritual songs, singing with grace in your hearts to the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And whatever you do in word or deed, do all in the name of the Lord Jesus, giving thanks to God the Father through Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Wives, submit yourselves to your own husbands, as it is fitting in the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Husbands, love your wives, and do not be bitter toward them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Children, obey your parents in all things, for this is well pleasing to the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Fathers, do not provoke your children to anger, lest they be discouraged.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Servants, obey your masters in all things according to the flesh, serving not only when they are watching, as the servants of men, but in singleness of heart, fearing God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And whatever you do, do it heartily, as for the Lord and not for men,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: knowing that from the Lord you will receive the reward of the inheritance. For you serve the Lord Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he who does wrong will receive for the wrong which he has done, and there is no partiality.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Masters, give to your servants that which is just and fair, knowing that you also have a Master in heaven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Continue in prayer, and be watchful with thanksgiving,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: while praying also for us, that God would open to us a door of utterance to speak the mystery of Christ, for which I am also in chains,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: that I may reveal it clearly, as I ought to speak.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Walk in wisdom toward those who are outside, wisely using the opportunity.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let your speech always be with grace, seasoned with salt, that you may know how you should answer everyone.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Tychicus, who is a beloved brother and a faithful minister and fellow servant in the Lord, will tell you all the news about me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I have sent him to you for this very purpose, that he might know your circumstances and comfort your hearts,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: with Onesimus, a faithful and beloved brother, who is one of you. They will make known to you everything which is happening here.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Aristarchus my fellow prisoner greets you, with Mark, the cousin of Barnabas (concerning whom you received instructions: If he comes to you, receive him),
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Jesus, who is called Justus. These are my only fellow workers for the kingdom of God who are of the circumcision. They have been a comfort to me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Epaphras greets you. He is one of you, a servant of Christ, always laboring fervently for you in prayers, that you may stand mature and complete in the entire will of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I bear witness of him, that he has a great zeal for you, those who are in Laodicea, and those in Hierapolis.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Luke, the beloved physician, and Demas greet you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Greet the brothers who are in Laodicea, and Nympha, and the church which is in his house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When this epistle is read among you, ensure that it is read also in the church of the Laodiceans, and that you, likewise, read the epistle from Laodicea.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Tell Archippus, “Make sure that you fulfill the ministry which you have received in the Lord.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I, Paul, write this greeting with my own hand. Remember my chains. Grace be with you. Amen.
verses.speaker: Narrator
